General. These Terms and Conditions of Restricted Stock Unit Award - Performance Award (these “Terms”) apply to a particular\nrestricted stock unit award (the “Award”) granted by Apple Inc., a California corporation (the “Company”), and are incorporated by reference in\nthe Notice of Grant (the “Grant Notice”) corresponding to that particular grant. The recipient of the Award identified in the Grant Notice is\nreferred to as the “Participant.” The effective date of grant of the Award as set forth in the Grant Notice is referred to as the “Award Date.” The\nAward was granted under and is subject to the provisions of the Apple Inc. 2022 Employee Stock Plan, as amended from time to time (the\n“Plan”). Capitalized terms are defined in the Plan if not defined herein. The Award is discretionary and has been granted to the Participant in\naddition to, and not in lieu of, any other form of compensation otherwise payable or to be paid to the Participant. The Grant Notice and these\nTerms (including Exhibit A hereto, incorporated herein by this reference) are collectively referred to as the “Award Agreement” applicable to the\nAward.\n2.    RSUs. As used herein, the term “RSU” shall mean a non-voting unit of measurement which is deemed for bookkeeping purposes to\nbe equivalent to one outstanding Share solely for purposes of the Plan and this Award Agreement. The RSUs shall be used solely as a device\nfor the determination of the Shares eventually to be issued to the Participant if such RSUs vest pursuant to this Award Agreement. The RSUs are\nan unfunded and unsecured right to receive Shares and shall not be treated as property or as a trust fund of any kind.\n3.    Vesting. Subject to Sections 4 and 8 below, the Award shall vest and become nonforfeitable as set forth in the Grant Notice and\nExhibit A hereto. (The vesting date set forth in the Grant Notice is referred to herein as a “Vesting Date”).\n4.    Continuance of Employment. Except as provided in this Section 4 and in Section 8 below, vesting of the Award requires continued\nactive employment or service through the Vesting Date as a condition to the vesting of the Award and the rights and benefits under this Award\nAgreement. Employment or service for only a portion of the performance or vesting period, even if a substantial portion, will not entitle the\nParticipant to any proportionate vesting of the Award. For purposes of this Award Agreement, active service shall include (a) the duration of an\napproved leave of absence (other than a personal leave of absence) and (b) the first thirty (30) days of an approved personal leave of absence,\nin each case as approved by the Company, in its sole discretion. The vesting of the Award shall be tolled beginning on the thirty-first (31st) day of\na personal leave of absence.\nNothing contained in this Award Agreement or the Plan constitutes an employment or service commitment by the Company, affects the\nParticipant’s status as an employee at will who is subject to termination with or without cause, confers upon the Participant any right to remain\nemployed by or in service to the Company or any Subsidiary, interferes in any way with the right of the Company or any Subsidiary at any time to\nterminate such employment or service, or affects the right of the Company or any Subsidiary to increase or decrease the Participant’s other\ncompensation or benefits. Dividend and Voting Rights.\n(a)    Limitations on Rights Associated with RSUs. The Participant shall have no rights as a shareholder of the Company, no\ndividend rights (except as expressly provided in Section 5(b) with respect to Dividend Equivalent Rights) and no voting rights, with respect to the\nRSUs or any Shares underlying or issuable in respect of such RSUs until such Shares are actually issued to and held of record by the\nParticipant. As of any date that the Company pays an ordinary cash dividend on its Shares, the\nCompany shall credit the Participant with a dollar amount equal to (i) the per share cash dividend paid by the Company on its Shares on such\ndate, multiplied by (ii) the total target number of RSUs (with such total number adjusted pursuant to Section 11 of the Plan) subject to the Award\nthat are outstanding on the record date for that dividend (a “Dividend Equivalent Right”). In this regard, the Participant authorizes the Company and/or the Employer, or\ntheir respective agents, at their discretion and pursuant to such procedures as they may specify from time to time, to satisfy any applicable\nwithholding obligations with regard to all Tax-Related Items by one or a combination of the following:\n(a)    withholding from any wages or other cash compensation payable to the Participant by the Company and/or the Employer;\n(b)    withholding otherwise deliverable Shares and/or from otherwise payable Dividend Equivalent Rights to be issued or paid\nupon vesting/settlement of the Award;\n(c)     arranging for the sale of Shares otherwise deliverable to the Participant (on the Participant’s behalf and at the Participant’s\ndirection pursuant to this authorization), including selling Shares as part of a block trade with other Participants in the Plan;\n(d)    withholding from the proceeds of the sale of Shares acquired upon vesting/settlement of the Award; or\n(e)    any other method of withholding determined by the Company to be permitted under the Plan and, to the extent required by\nApplicable Law or under the Plan, approved by the Committee.\nNotwithstanding the foregoing, if the Participant is an officer of the Company who is subject to Section 16 of the Exchange Act, then\nthe Company must satisfy any withholding obligations arising upon the occurrence of a taxable or tax withholding event, as applicable,\nby withholding Shares otherwise deliverable or an amount otherwise payable upon settlement of Dividend Equivalent Rights pursuant to method\n(b), unless the Board or the Committee determines in its discretion to satisfy the obligation for Tax-Related Items by one or a combination of\nmethods (a), (b), (c), and (d) above.\n    The Company may withhold or account for Tax-Related Items by considering statutory withholding amounts or other withholding rates,\nincluding maximum rates applicable in the Participant's jurisdictions(s). If the maximum rate is used, any over-withheld amount may be refunded\nto the Participant in cash by the Company or Employer (with no entitlement to the Share equivalent) or if not refunded, the Participant may seek\na refund from the local tax authorities. If the obligation for Tax-Related Items is satisfied by withholding a number of Shares as described herein, for tax\npurposes, the Participant is deemed to have been issued the full number of Shares subject to the vested RSUs, notwithstanding that a number\nof the Shares are held back solely for the purpose of paying the Tax-Related Items. The Company may refuse to issue or deliver to the\nParticipant any Shares or the proceeds of the sale of Shares if the Participant fails to comply with the Participant’s obligations in connection with\nthe Tax-Related Items.\n12.    Electronic Delivery and Acceptance. The Company may, in its sole discretion, deliver any documents related to the Award by\nelectronic means or request the Participant’s consent to participate in the Plan by electronic means. The Participant hereby consents to receive\nall applicable documentation by electronic delivery and to participate in the Plan through an on-line or voice activated system established and\nmaintained by the Company or a third party vendor designated by the Company.\n13.    Data Privacy. By participating in the Plan, the Participant acknowledges and consents to the collection, use, processing and\ntransfer of personal data as described in this Section 13. The Company, its related entities, and the Employer hold certain personal information\nabout the Participant, including the Participant’s name, home address and telephone number, email address, date of birth, social security\nnumber or other employee identification number, salary, nationality, job title, any Shares or directorships held in the Company, details of all RSUs\nor any other entitlement to Shares or equivalent benefits awarded, canceled, purchased, vested, unvested or outstanding in the Participant’s\nfavor, for the purpose of managing and administering the Plan (“Data”). The Participant acknowledges that the transferors and transferees of such Data\nmay be located anywhere in the world and hereby authorizes each of them to receive, possess, use, retain and transfer the Data, in electronic or\nother form, for the purposes of implementing, administering and managing the Participant’s participation in the Plan, including any transfer of\nsuch Data as may be required for the administration of the Plan and/or the subsequent holding of Shares on the Participant’s behalf to a broker\nor to other third party with whom the Participant may elect to deposit any Shares acquired under the Plan (whether pursuant to the Award or\notherwise).\n14.    Notices. Any notice to be given under the terms of this Award Agreement shall be in writing and addressed to the Company at its\nprincipal office to the attention of the Secretary, and to the Participant at the Participant’s last address reflected on the Company’s records, or at\nsuch other address as either party may hereafter designate in writing to the other. Plan. The Award and all rights of the Participant under this Award Agreement are subject to the terms and conditions of the\nprovisions of the Plan, incorporated herein by reference. The Participant agrees to be bound by the terms of the Plan and this Award Agreement.\nThe Participant acknowledges having read and understood the Plan, the Prospectus for the Plan, and this Award Agreement. Entire Agreement. This Award Agreement and the Plan together constitute the entire agreement and supersede all prior\nunderstandings and agreements, written or oral, of the parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof. The Plan and this Award\nAgreement may be amended pursuant to Section 15 of the Plan. Such amendment must be in writing and signed by the Company. The\nCompany may, however, unilaterally waive any provision hereof in writing to the extent such waiver does not materially and adversely affect the\ninterests of the Participant hereunder, but no such waiver shall operate as or be construed to be a subsequent waiver of the same provision or a\nwaiver of any other provision hereof.\n17.    Limitation on the Participant’s Rights. Participation in the Plan confers no rights or interests other than as herein provided. Neither the Plan nor any underlying program, in and of itself, has any assets. The Participant shall have only the\nrights of a general unsecured creditor of the Company with respect to the settlement of RSUs, and rights no greater than the right to receive the\nShares as a general unsecured creditor with respect to RSUs, as and when settled hereunder.\n18.    Section Headings. The section headings of this Award Agreement are for convenience of reference only and shall not be deemed\nto alter or affect any provision hereof.\n19.    Governing Law. This Award Agreement shall be governed by and construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the\nState of California and applicable U.S. federal laws without regard to conflict of law principles thereunder.\n20.    Choice of Venue. Construction. It is intended that the terms of the Award will not result in the imposition of any tax liability pursuant to Section 409A\nof the Code. The provisions of this Award Agreement are severable and if any one of more provisions are determined to be illegal\nor otherwise unenforceable, in whole or in part, the remaining provisions shall nevertheless be binding and enforceable.\n23. foregoing.\n* * * * *\n6'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 88}, page_content='PERFORMANCE AWARD\nEXHIBIT A\nPERFORMANCE VESTING REQUIREMENTS\nThe RSUs (and related Dividend Equivalent Rights) subject to the Award that will vest on the Vesting Date will be determined based on\nthe Company’s relative total shareholder return (“TSR”) Percentile for the Performance Period.\nThe percentage of the RSUs (and related Dividend Equivalent Rights) that vest on the Vesting Date will be determined as follows:\n• If the Company’s TSR Percentile for the Performance Period is at the [ ] ([ ]) percentile or greater, [ ] ([ ]%) of the target RSUs\nwill vest on the Vesting Date.\n• If the Company’s TSR Percentile for the Performance Period is at the [ ] ([ ]) percentile, [ ] ([ ]%) of the target RSUs will vest on\nthe Vesting Date.\n• If the Company’s TSR Percentile for the Performance Period is at the [ ] ([ ]) percentile, [ ] ([ ]%) of the target RSUs will vest on\nthe Vesting Date.\n• If the Company’s TSR Percentile for the Performance Period is below the [ ] ([ ]) percentile, [ ] ([ ]%) of the RSUs will vest on the\nVesting Date.\nFor TSR Percentile performance for the Performance Period between the levels indicated above, the portion of the RSUs that will vest\non the Vesting Date will be determined on a straight-line basis (i.e., linearly interpolated) between the two nearest vesting percentages indicated\nabove.\nNotwithstanding the foregoing, if the Company’s TSR for the Performance Period is negative, in no event shall more than one hundred\npercent (100%) of the target RSUs vest.\nThe number of RSUs that vest on the Vesting Date will be rounded to the nearest whole unit, and the balance of the RSUs will not vest\nand will terminate on that Vesting Date.\n    For purposes of the Award, the following definitions will apply:\n• “TSR Percentile” means the percentile ranking of the Company’s TSR among the TSRs for the Comparison Group members for\nthe Performance Period. In determining the Company’s TSR Percentile for the Performance Period, in the event that the\nCompany’s TSR for the Performance Period is equal to the TSR(s) of one or more other Comparison Group members for that\nsame period, the Company’s TSR Percentile ranking will be determined by ranking the Company’s TSR for that period as being\ngreater than such other Comparison Group members.\n• “Comparison Group” means the Company and each other company included in the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index on the first\nday of the Performance Period and, except as provided below, the common stock (or similar equity security) of which continues\nto be listed or traded on a national securities exchange through the last trading day of the Performance Period. In the event a\nmember of the Comparison Group files for bankruptcy or liquidates due to an insolvency, such company shall continue to be\ntreated as a Comparison Group member, and such company’s Ending Price will be treated as $0 if the common stock (or similar\nequity security) of such company is no longer listed or\nA-1'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 89}, page_content='traded on a national securities exchange on the last trading day of the Performance Period. In the event of a formation of a new\nparent company by a Comparison Group member, substantially all of the assets and liabilities of which consist immediately after\nthe transaction of the equity interests in the original Comparison Group member or the assets and liabilities of such Comparison\nGroup member immediately prior to the transaction, such new parent company shall be substituted for the Comparison Group\nmember to the extent (and for such period of time) as its common stock (or similar equity securities) are listed or traded on a\nnational securities exchange but the common stock (or similar equity securities) of the original Comparison Group member are\nnot. In the event of a merger or other business combination of two Comparison Group members (including, without limitation, the\nacquisition of one Comparison Group member, or all or substantially all of its assets, by another Comparison Group member),\nthe surviving, resulting or successor entity, as the case may be, shall continue to be treated as a member of the Comparison\nGroup, provided that the common stock (or similar equity security) of such entity is listed or traded on a national securities\nexchange through the last trading day of the Performance Period. With respect to the preceding two sentences, the applicable\nstock prices shall be equitably and proportionately adjusted to the extent (if any) necessary to preserve the intended incentives\nof the awards and mitigate the impact of the transaction.\n• “TSR” shall be determined with respect to the Company and any other Comparison Group member by dividing: (a) the sum of\n(i) the difference obtained by subtracting the applicable Beginning Price from the applicable Ending Price and (ii) all dividends\nand other distributions during the Performance Period by (b) the applicable Beginning Price. Any non-cash distributions shall be\nvalued at fair market value. For the purpose of determining TSR, the value of dividends and other distributions shall be\ndetermined by treating them as reinvested in additional shares of stock at the closing market price on the date of distribution.\n• “Beginning Price” means, with respect to the Company and any other Comparison Group member, the average of the closing\nmarket prices of such company’s common stock on the principal exchange on which such stock is traded for the twenty (20)\nconsecutive trading days beginning with the first trading day of the Performance Period. For the purpose of determining\nBeginning Price, the value of dividends and other distributions shall be determined by treating them as reinvested in additional\nshares of stock at the closing market price on the date of distribution.\n• “Ending Price” means, with respect to the Company and any other Comparison Group member, the average of the closing\nmarket prices of such company’s common stock on the principal exchange on which such stock is traded for the twenty (20)\nconsecutive trading days ending on the last trading day of the Performance Period. For the purpose of determining Ending\nPrice, the value of dividends and other distributions shall be determined by treating them as reinvested in additional shares of\nstock at the closing market price on the date of distribution.\n    With respect to the computation of TSR, Beginning Price, and Ending Price, there shall also be an equitable and proportionate adjustment to\nthe extent (if any) necessary to preserve the intended incentives of the awards and mitigate the impact of any stock split, stock dividend or\nreverse stock split occurring during the Performance Period (or during the applicable twenty (20)-day period in determining Beginning Price or\nEnding Price, as the case may be).\n    In the event of any ambiguity or discrepancy, the determination of the Committee shall be final and binding.\n* * * * *'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 90}, page_content='Exhibit 10.21\nAPPLE INC.\n2022 EMPLOYEE STOCK PLAN\nRESTRICTED STOCK UNIT AWARD AGREEMENT\nNOTICE OF GRANT\nName:                    (the “Participant”)\nEmployee ID:    \nGrant Number:    \nNo. of Units Subject to Award:    \nAward Date:                (the “Award Date”)\nVesting Commencement Date:    (the “Vesting Commencement Date”)\nVesting Schedule:    \nThis restricted stock unit award (the “Award”) is granted under and governed by the terms and conditions of the Apple Inc. 2022\nEmployee Stock Plan and the Terms and Conditions of Restricted Stock Unit Award, which are incorporated herein by reference.\nYou do not have to accept the Award. If you wish to decline your Award, you should promptly notify Apple Inc.’s Stock Plan Group of your\ndecision at peoplesupport@apple.com. If you do not provide such notification by the last day of the calendar month prior to the first Vesting Date,\nyou will be deemed to have accepted your Award on the terms and conditions set forth herein.\nA-2'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 91}, page_content='APPLE INC.\n2022 EMPLOYEE STOCK PLAN\nRESTRICTED STOCK UNIT AWARD AGREEMENT\nTERMS AND CONDITIONS OF RESTRICTED STOCK UNIT AWARD\n1. General. These Terms and Conditions of Restricted Stock Unit Award (these “Terms”) apply to a particular restricted stock unit\naward (the “Award”) granted by Apple Inc., a California corporation (the “Company”), and are incorporated by reference in the Notice of Grant\n(the “Grant Notice”) corresponding to that particular grant. The recipient of the Award identified in the Grant Notice is referred to as the\n“Participant.” The effective date of grant of the Award as set forth in the Grant Notice is referred to as the “Award Date.” The Award was granted\nunder and is subject to the provisions of the Apple Inc. 2022 Employee Stock Plan, as amended from time to time (the “Plan”). Capitalized terms\nare defined in the Plan if not defined herein. The Award is discretionary and has been granted to the Participant in addition to, and not in lieu of,\nany other form of compensation otherwise payable or to be paid to the Participant. The Grant Notice and these Terms are collectively referred to\nas the “Award Agreement” applicable to the Award.\n2.    RSUs. As used herein, the term “RSU” shall mean a non-voting unit of measurement which is deemed for bookkeeping purposes to\nbe equivalent to one outstanding Share solely for purposes of the Plan and this Award Agreement. RSUs shall be used solely as a device for the\ndetermination of the Shares eventually to be issued to the Participant if such RSUs vest pursuant to this Award Agreement. The RSUs are an\nunfunded and unsecured right to receive Shares and shall not be treated as property or as a trust fund of any kind.\n3.    Vesting. Subject to Sections 4 and 8 below, the Award shall vest and become nonforfeitable as set forth in the Grant Notice. (Each\nvesting date set forth in the Grant Notice is referred to herein as a “Vesting Date.”) Unless and until the Company elects to issue fractional\nShares in settlement of a vested RSU, any fractional RSUs that vest on a Vesting Date shall be carried forward and vest when such combined\nfractional RSUs result in a full RSU and any fractional RSU that is not carried forward as a result of a termination of the Award prior to the next\nsubsequent Vesting Date shall be forfeited.\n4.    Continuance of Employment. Except as provided in this Section 4 and in Section 8 below, vesting of the Award requires continued\nactive employment or service through each applicable Vesting Date as a condition to the vesting of the applicable installment of the Award and\nthe rights and benefits under this Award Agreement. Employment or service for only a portion of the period between the Award Date and the first\nVesting Date, even if a substantial portion, will not entitle the Participant to any proportionate vesting of the Award. For purposes of this Award\nAgreement, active service shall include (a) the duration of an approved leave of absence (other than a personal leave of absence) and (b) the\nfirst thirty (30) days of an approved personal leave of absence, in each case as approved by the Company, in its sole discretion. The vesting of\nthe Award shall be tolled beginning on the thirty-first (31st) day of a personal leave of absence.\nNothing contained in this Award Agreement or the Plan constitutes an employment or service commitment by the Company, affects the\nParticipant’s status as an employee at will who is subject to termination with or without cause, confers upon the Participant any right to remain\nemployed by or in service to the Company or any Subsidiary, interferes in any way with the right of the Company or any Subsidiary at any time to\nterminate such employment or service, or affects the right of the Company or any Subsidiary to increase or decrease the Participant’s other\ncompensation or benefits. Nothing in this Section 4, however, is intended to adversely affect any independent contractual right of the Participant\nwithout the Participant’s consent thereto.\n1'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 92}, page_content='5.    Dividend and Voting Rights.\n(a)    Limitations on Rights Associated with RSUs. The Participant shall have no rights as a shareholder of the Company, no\ndividend rights (except as expressly provided in Section 5(b) with respect to Dividend Equivalent Rights) and no voting rights, with respect to the\nRSUs or any Shares underlying or issuable in respect of such RSUs until such Shares are actually issued to and held of record by the\nParticipant. No adjustments will be made for dividends or other rights of a holder for which the record date is prior to the date of issuance of the\nShares as reflected in the book entry evidencing such Shares.\n(b)    Dividend Equivalent Rights. As of any date that the Company pays an ordinary cash dividend on its Shares, the\nCompany shall credit the Participant with a dollar amount equal to (i) the per share cash dividend paid by the Company on its Shares on such\ndate, multiplied by (ii) the total number of RSUs (with such total number adjusted pursuant to Section 11 of the Plan) subject to the Award that\nare outstanding on the record date for that dividend (a “Dividend Equivalent Right”). Any Dividend Equivalent Rights credited pursuant to the\nforegoing provisions of this Section 5(b) shall be subject to the same vesting, payment and other terms, conditions and restrictions as the original\nRSUs to which they relate, including the obligation to satisfy the Tax-Related Items; provided, however, that the amount of any vested Dividend\nEquivalent Rights shall be paid in cash. No crediting of Dividend Equivalent Rights shall be made pursuant to this Section 5(b) with respect to\nany RSUs which, as of the record date for that dividend, have either been paid pursuant to Section 7 or terminated pursuant to Section 8.\n6.    Restrictions on Transfer. Except as provided in Section 4(c) of the Plan, the Award, the Dividend Equivalent Rights and any\ninterest therein or amount or Shares issued in respect thereof shall not be sold, assigned, transferred, pledged or otherwise disposed of,\nalienated or encumbered, either voluntarily or involuntarily.\n7.    Timing and Manner of Settlement of RSUs. On or as soon as administratively practical following each Vesting Date determined\npursuant to Sections 3 or 8 or following the Participant’s death as specified in Section 8(d) (and in all events not later than two and one-half (2 ½)\nmonths after such Vesting Date or the date of the Participant’s death, as applicable), the Company shall deliver to the Participant a number of\nShares equal to the number of RSUs subject to the Award that vest on such vesting event (or, in the case of the Participant’s Retirement or\nDisability, are scheduled to settle on such vesting event) less Tax-Related Items, unless such RSUs terminate prior to the applicable Vesting\nDate pursuant to Section 8. The Company’s obligation to deliver Shares or otherwise settle vested RSUs is subject to the condition precedent\nthat the Participant or other person entitled under the Plan to receive any Shares with respect to the vested RSUs deliver to the Company any\nrepresentations or other documents or assurances required pursuant to Section 13(c) of the Plan. The Participant shall have no further rights\nwith respect to any RSUs that are settled or that are forfeited pursuant to Section 8.\n8.    Effect of Termination of Service.\n(a)    Except as expressly provided in Section 4 or this Section 8, the Participant’s RSUs (as well as the related Dividend\nEquivalent Rights) shall terminate and be forfeited to the extent such RSUs have not become vested prior to the date of the Participant’s\nTermination of Service (the “Severance Date”), regardless of the reason for the Participant’s Termination of Service, whether with or without\ncause, voluntarily or involuntarily, or whether the Participant was employed or provided services for a portion of the vesting period prior to a\nVesting Date.\n(b)    Notwithstanding the foregoing, and except as otherwise provided by the Committee, in the event of the Participant’s\nTermination of Service due to the Participant’s Retirement (defined below) on or after the first anniversary of the Award Date, any unvested\nRSUs (as well as the related Dividend Equivalent Rights) shall continue to be eligible to vest on a pro rata basis (in accordance\n2'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 93}, page_content='with the schedule set forth in the Grant Notice and Section 8(d)), without regard to the Participant’s Termination of Service, determined by\nmultiplying (i) the number of RSUs eligible to vest on the applicable Vesting Date, by (ii) a fraction, the numerator of which shall be the number of\ndays that have elapsed between the Award Date and the Participant’s Retirement date, and the denominator of which shall be the total number\nof days contained in the period between the Award Date and the applicable Vesting Date. For purposes of this Award Agreement, “Retirement”\nmeans the Participant’s Termination of Service on or after the Participant both has reached the age of sixty (60) and has completed ten (10)\nyears of service with the Company, or any Subsidiary (including service with any entity acquired by the Company) as of the Severance Date, as\ndetermined in the sole discretion of the Committee. In the event the Participant’s Termination of Service occurs prior to the first anniversary of\nthe Award Date, this Section 8(b) shall not apply, unless the Committee shall otherwise determine in its sole discretion. For purposes of this\nSection 8(b), a Termination of Service shall not include the Participant’s Termination of Service resulting from the Participant’s Disability or death\n(in which case Section 8(c) or 8(d), as applicable, will apply).\n(c)    In the event of the Participant’s Termination of Service due to the Participant’s Disability, any unvested RSUs shall continue\nto be eligible to vest in full (in accordance with the schedule set forth in the Grant Notice and Section 8(d)) without regard to the Participant’s\nTermination of Service.\n(d)    In the event of the Participant’s Termination of Service due to the Participant’s death, all unvested RSUs eligible to vest on\nVesting Date(s) subsequent to the Participant’s death shall accelerate and vest immediately, and upon the Participant’s death following the\nParticipant’s Termination of Service due to Disability or Retirement any RSUs that were eligible to vest in full, or pro rata in the case of\nRetirement, will be settled as soon as administratively practicable after the Participant’s death in accordance with Section 7.\n(e)    If any unvested RSUs are terminated hereunder, such RSUs (as well as the related Dividend Equivalent Rights) shall\nautomatically terminate and be canceled as of the applicable Severance Date without payment of any consideration by the Company and without\nany other action by the Participant or the Participant’s beneficiary or personal representative, as the case may be.\n9.    Recoupment. Notwithstanding any other provision herein, the Award and any Shares or other amount or property that may be\nissued, delivered or paid in respect of the Award, as well as any consideration that may be received in respect of a sale or other disposition of\nany such Shares or property, shall be subject to any recoupment, “clawback” or similar provisions of Applicable Laws relevant to the Company’s\nShares and any recoupment, “clawback” or similar policy maintained by the Company from time to time. In addition, the Company may require\nthe Participant to deliver or otherwise repay to the Company the Award and any Shares or other amount or property that may be issued,\ndelivered or paid in respect of the Award, as well as any consideration that may be received in respect of a sale or other disposition of any such\nShares or property, if the Company reasonably determines that one or more of the following has occurred:\n(a) during the period of the Participant’s employment or service with the Company or any of its Subsidiaries (the\n“Employment Period”), the Participant has committed a felony (under the laws of the United States or any relevant state, or a similar crime or\noffense under the applicable laws of any relevant foreign jurisdiction);\n(b) during the Employment Period or at any time thereafter, the Participant has committed or engaged in a breach of\nconfidentiality, or an unauthorized disclosure or use of inside information, customer lists, trade secrets or other confidential information of the\nCompany or any of its Subsidiaries;\n3'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 94}, page_content='(c) during the Employment Period or at any time thereafter, the Participant has committed or engaged in an act of theft,\nembezzlement or fraud, or materially breached any agreement to which the Participant is a party with the Company or any of its Subsidiaries.\nFor purposes of the foregoing, the Participant expressly and explicitly authorizes the Company to issue instructions, on the Participant’s\nbehalf, to any brokerage firm or third party administrator holding the Participant’s Shares and/or other amounts acquired under the Plan to re-\nconvey, transfer, or otherwise return such Shares and/or other amounts to the Company. By accepting this Award, the Participant further agrees\nto comply with any request or demand for repayment by the Company in order to comply with such policies or Applicable Laws. To the extent\nthat the terms of this Agreement and any Company recoupment policy conflict, the terms of the recoupment policy shall prevail. This Section 9 is\nnot the Company’s exclusive remedy with respect to such matters.\n10.    Adjustments Upon Specified Events. Upon the occurrence of certain events relating to the Company’s stock contemplated by\nSection 11 of the Plan (including, without limitation, an extraordinary cash dividend on such stock), the Committee shall make adjustments in\naccordance with such section in the number of RSUs then outstanding and the number and kind of securities that may be issued in respect of\nthe Award. No such adjustment shall be made with respect to any ordinary cash dividend for which Dividend Equivalent Rights are credited\npursuant to Section 5(b).\n11.    Responsibility for Taxes. The Participant acknowledges that, regardless of any action the Company and/or the Participant’s\nemployer (“Employer”) take with respect to any Tax-Related Items, the ultimate liability for all Tax-Related Items is and remains the Participant’s\nresponsibility and may exceed the amount, if any, actually withheld by the Company or the Employer. The Participant further acknowledges that\nthe Company and/or the Employer (i) make no representations or undertakings regarding the treatment of any Tax-Related Items in connection\nwith any aspect of the Award, including the grant of the RSUs, the vesting of the RSUs, the delivery of Shares, the subsequent sale of any\nShares acquired at vesting, and the receipt of any dividends and/or Dividend Equivalent Rights; and (ii) do not commit to and are under no\nobligation to structure the terms of the grant or any aspect of the Award to reduce or eliminate the Participant’s liability for Tax-Related Items or\nachieve any particular tax result. If the maximum rate is used, any over-withheld amount may be refunded\nto the Participant in cash by the Company or Employer (with no entitlement to the Share equivalent) or if not refunded, the Participant may seek\na refund from the local tax authorities. Neither the Plan nor any underlying program, in and of itself, has any assets. Choice of Venue. For purposes of litigating any dispute that arises directly or indirectly from the relationship of the parties\nevidenced by this grant or this Award Agreement, the parties hereby submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the State of California and agree that\nsuch litigation shall be conducted only in the courts of Santa Clara County, California, or the federal courts for the Northern District of California,\nand no other courts, where this grant is made or to be performed.\n21.    Construction. It is intended that the terms of the Award will not result in the imposition of any tax liability pursuant to Section 409A\nof the Code. This Award Agreement shall be construed and interpreted consistent with that intent.\n22.    Severability. General. These Terms and Conditions of Restricted Stock Unit Award - Performance Award (these “Terms”) apply to a particular\nrestricted stock unit award (the “Award”) granted by Apple Inc., a California corporation (the “Company”), and are incorporated by reference in\nthe Notice of Grant (the “Grant Notice”) corresponding to that particular grant. The recipient of the Award identified in the Grant Notice is\nreferred to as the “Participant.” The effective date of grant of the Award as set forth in the Grant Notice is referred to as the “Award Date.” The\nAward was granted under and is subject to the provisions of the Apple Inc. 2022 Employee Stock Plan, as amended from time to time (the\n“Plan”). Capitalized terms are defined in the Plan if not defined herein. The Award is discretionary and has been granted to the Participant in\naddition to, and not in lieu of, any other form of compensation otherwise payable or to be paid to the Participant. The Grant Notice and these\nTerms (including Exhibit A hereto, incorporated herein by this reference) are collectively referred to as the “Award Agreement” applicable to the\nAward.\n2.    RSUs. As used herein, the term “RSU” shall mean a non-voting unit of measurement which is deemed for bookkeeping purposes to\nbe equivalent to one outstanding Share solely for purposes of the Plan and this Award Agreement. The RSUs shall be used solely as a device\nfor the determination of the Shares eventually to be issued to the Participant if such RSUs vest pursuant to this Award Agreement. The RSUs are\nan unfunded and unsecured right to receive Shares and shall not be treated as property or as a trust fund of any kind.\n3.    Vesting. Subject to Sections 4 and 8 below, the Award shall vest and become nonforfeitable as set forth in the Grant Notice and\nExhibit A hereto. (The vesting date set forth in the Grant Notice is referred to herein as a “Vesting Date”).\n4.    Continuance of Employment. Except as provided in this Section 4 and in Section 8 below, vesting of the Award requires continued\nactive employment or service through the Vesting Date as a condition to the vesting of the Award and the rights and benefits under this Award\nAgreement. Employment or service for only a portion of the performance or vesting period, even if a substantial portion, will not entitle the\nParticipant to any proportionate vesting of the Award. For purposes of this Award Agreement, active service shall include (a) the duration of an\napproved leave of absence (other than a personal leave of absence) and (b) the first thirty (30) days of an approved personal leave of absence,\nin each case as approved by the Company, in its sole discretion. The vesting of the Award shall be tolled beginning on the thirty-first (31st) day of\na personal leave of absence.\nNothing contained in this Award Agreement or the Plan constitutes an employment or service commitment by the Company, affects the\nParticipant’s status as an employee at will who is subject to termination with or without cause, confers upon the Participant any right to remain\nemployed by or in service to the Company or any Subsidiary, interferes in any way with the right of the Company or any Subsidiary at any time to\nterminate such employment or service, or affects the right of the Company or any Subsidiary to increase or decrease the Participant’s other\ncompensation or benefits. Nothing in this Section 4, however, is intended to adversely affect any independent contractual right of the Participant\nwithout the Participant’s consent thereto.\n1'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 100}, page_content='5.    Dividend and Voting Rights.\n(a)    Limitations on Rights Associated with RSUs. The Participant shall have no rights as a shareholder of the Company, no\ndividend rights (except as expressly provided in Section 5(b) with respect to Dividend Equivalent Rights) and no voting rights, with respect to the\nRSUs or any Shares underlying or issuable in respect of such RSUs until such Shares are actually issued to and held of record by the\nParticipant. No adjustments will be made for dividends or other rights of a holder for which the record date is prior to the date of issuance of the\nShares as reflected in the book entry evidencing such Shares.\n(b)    Dividend Equivalent Rights. As of any date that the Company pays an ordinary cash dividend on its Shares, the\nCompany shall credit the Participant with a dollar amount equal to (i) the per share cash dividend paid by the Company on its Shares on such\ndate, multiplied by (ii) the total target number of RSUs (with such total number adjusted pursuant to Section 11 of the Plan) subject to the Award\nthat are outstanding on the record date for that dividend (a “Dividend Equivalent Right”). Any Dividend Equivalent Rights credited pursuant to\nthe foregoing provisions of this Section 5(b) shall be subject to the same vesting, payment and other terms, conditions and restrictions as the\noriginal RSUs to which they relate, including the obligation to satisfy the Tax-Related Items; provided, however, that the amount of any vested\nDividend Equivalent Rights shall be paid in cash. For purposes of clarity, the percentage of the Dividend Equivalent Rights that are paid will\ncorrespond to the percentage of the total target number of RSUs that vest on the Vesting Date, after giving effect to Exhibit A. No crediting of\nDividend Equivalent Rights shall be made pursuant to this Section 5(b) with respect to any RSUs which, as of the record date for that dividend,\nhave either been paid pursuant to Section 7 or terminated pursuant to Section 8 or Exhibit A.\n6.    Restrictions on Transfer. Except as provided in Section 4(c) of the Plan, the Award, the Dividend Equivalent Rights and any\ninterest therein or amount or Shares issued in respect thereof shall not be sold, assigned, transferred, pledged or otherwise disposed of,\nalienated or encumbered, either voluntarily or involuntarily.\n7.    Timing and Manner of Settlement of RSUs. On or as soon as administratively practical following the Vesting Date pursuant to\nSection 3 or Section 8 (and in all events not later than two and one-half (2 ½) months after such Vesting Date), the Company shall deliver to the\nParticipant a number of Shares equal to the number of RSUs subject to the Award that vest on such vesting event (or, in the case of the\nParticipant’s Retirement, death or Disability, are scheduled to settle on such vesting event), less Tax-Related Items, unless such RSUs terminate\nprior to the Vesting Date pursuant to Section 8. The Participant shall have\nno further rights with respect to any RSUs that are settled or that are forfeited pursuant to Section 8.\n8.    Effect of Termination of Service.\n(a) Except as expressly provided in Section 4 or this Section 8, the Participant’s RSUs (as well as the related Dividend\nEquivalent Rights) shall terminate and be forfeited to the extent such RSUs have not become vested prior to the date of the Participant’s\nTermination of Service (the “Severance Date”), regardless of the reason for the Participant’s Termination of Service, whether with or without\ncause, voluntarily or involuntarily or whether the Participant was employed or provided services for a portion of the vesting period prior to a\nVesting Date.\n(b) Notwithstanding the foregoing, and except as otherwise provided by the Committee, in the event of the Participant’s\nTermination of Service due to the Participant’s Retirement (defined below) on or after the first anniversary of the Award Date, death or Disability,\nany unvested\n2'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 101}, page_content='RSUs (as well as the related Dividend Equivalent Rights) shall continue to be eligible to vest on the Vesting Date without regard to the\nParticipant’s Termination of Service. In\nthe event the Participant’s Termination of Service occurs due to Retirement prior to the first anniversary of the Award Date, this Section 8(b) shall\nnot apply, unless the Committee shall otherwise determine in its sole discretion.\n(c) If any unvested RSUs are terminated hereunder, such RSUs (as well as the related Dividend Equivalent Rights) shall\nautomatically terminate and be canceled as of the applicable Severance Date (or, to the extent that any RSUs remain outstanding following the\nSeverance Date by reason of Section 8(b) but the applicable performance-based vesting conditions are not satisfied, such RSUs shall\nautomatically terminate and be canceled as of the Vesting Date, as provided in Exhibit A) without payment of any consideration by the Company\nand without any other action by the Participant, or the Participant’s beneficiary or personal representative, as the case may be.\n9. This\nAward Agreement creates only a contractual obligation on the part of the Company as to the RSUs and the settlement thereof and shall not be\nconstrued as creating a trust. Neither the Plan nor any underlying program, in and of itself, has any assets. The Participant shall have only the\nrights of a general unsecured creditor of the Company with respect to the settlement of RSUs, and rights no greater than the right to receive the\nShares as a general unsecured creditor with respect to RSUs, as and when settled hereunder.\n18.    Section Headings. The section headings of this Award Agreement are for convenience of reference only and shall not be deemed\nto alter or affect any provision hereof.\n19.    Governing Law. This Award Agreement shall be governed by and construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the\nState of California and applicable U.S. federal laws without regard to conflict of law principles thereunder.\n20.    Choice of Venue. For purposes of litigating any dispute that arises directly or indirectly from the relationship of the parties\nevidenced by this grant or this Award Agreement, the parties hereby submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the State of California and agree that\nsuch litigation shall be conducted only in the courts of Santa Clara County, California, or the federal courts for the Northern District of California,\nand no other courts, where this grant is made or to be performed.\n21.    Construction. It is intended that the terms of the Award will not result in the imposition of any tax liability pursuant to Section 409A\nof the Code. This Award Agreement shall be construed and interpreted consistent with that intent.\n22.    Severability. The provisions of this Award Agreement are severable and if any one of more provisions are determined to be illegal\nor otherwise unenforceable, in whole or in part, the remaining provisions shall nevertheless be binding and enforceable.\n23.    Imposition of Other Requirements. The Company reserves the right to impose other requirements on the Participant’s\nparticipation in the Plan, on the RSUs and on any Shares acquired under the Plan, to the extent the Company determines it is necessary or\nadvisable for legal or administrative reasons, and to require the Participant to sign any additional agreements or undertakings that may be\nnecessary to accomplish the foregoing.\n* * * * *\n6'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 105}, page_content='PERFORMANCE AWARD\nEXHIBIT A\nPERFORMANCE VESTING REQUIREMENTS\nThe RSUs (and related Dividend Equivalent Rights) subject to the Award that will vest on the Vesting Date will be determined based on\nthe Company’s relative total shareholder return (“TSR”) Percentile for the Performance Period.\nThe percentage of the RSUs (and related Dividend Equivalent Rights) that vest on the Vesting Date will be determined as follows:\n• If the Company’s TSR Percentile for the Performance Period is at the [ ] ([ ]) percentile or greater, [ ] ([ ]%) of the target RSUs\nwill vest on the Vesting Date.\n• If the Company’s TSR Percentile for the Performance Period is at the [ ] ([ ]) percentile, [ ] ([ ]%) of the target RSUs will vest on\nthe Vesting Date.\n• If the Company’s TSR Percentile for the Performance Period is at the [ ] ([ ]) percentile, [ ] ([ ]%) of the target RSUs will vest on\nthe Vesting Date.\n• If the Company’s TSR Percentile for the Performance Period is below the [ ] ([ ]) percentile, [ ] ([ ]%) of the RSUs will vest on the\nVesting Date.\nFor TSR Percentile performance for the Performance Period between the levels indicated above, the portion of the RSUs that will vest\non the Vesting Date will be determined on a straight-line basis (i.e., linearly interpolated) between the two nearest vesting percentages indicated\nabove.\nNotwithstanding the foregoing, if the Company’s TSR for the Performance Period is negative, in no event shall more than one hundred\npercent (100%) of the target RSUs vest.\nThe number of RSUs that vest on the Vesting Date will be rounded to the nearest whole unit, and the balance of the RSUs will not vest\nand will terminate on that Vesting Date.\n    For purposes of the Award, the following definitions will apply:\n• “TSR Percentile” means the percentile ranking of the Company’s TSR among the TSRs for the Comparison Group members for\nthe Performance Period. In determining the Company’s TSR Percentile for the Performance Period, in the event that the\nCompany’s TSR for the Performance Period is equal to the TSR(s) of one or more other Comparison Group members for that\nsame period, the Company’s TSR Percentile ranking will be determined by ranking the Company’s TSR for that period as being\ngreater than such other Comparison Group members.\n• “Comparison Group” means the Company and each other company included in the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index on the first\nday of the Performance Period and, except as provided below, the common stock (or similar equity security) of which continues\nto be listed or traded on a national securities exchange through the last trading day of the Performance Period. In the event a\nmember of the Comparison Group files for bankruptcy or liquidates due to an insolvency, such company shall continue to be\ntreated as a Comparison Group member, and such company’s Ending Price will be treated as $0 if the common stock (or similar\nequity security) of such company is no longer listed or\nA-1'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 106}, page_content='traded on a national securities exchange on the last trading day of the Performance Period. In the event of a formation of a new\nparent company by a Comparison Group member, substantially all of the assets and liabilities of which consist immediately after\nthe transaction of the equity interests in the original Comparison Group member or the assets and liabilities of such Comparison\nGroup member immediately prior to the transaction, such new parent company shall be substituted for the Comparison Group\nmember to the extent (and for such period of time) as its common stock (or similar equity securities) are listed or traded on a\nnational securities exchange but the common stock (or similar equity securities) of the original Comparison Group member are\nnot. In the event of a merger or other business combination of two Comparison Group members (including, without limitation, the\nacquisition of one Comparison Group member, or all or substantially all of its assets, by another Comparison Group member),\nthe surviving, resulting or successor entity, as the case may be, shall continue to be treated as a member of the Comparison\nGroup, provided that the common stock (or similar equity security) of such entity is listed or traded on a national securities\nexchange through the last trading day of the Performance Period. With respect to the preceding two sentences, the applicable\nstock prices shall be equitably and proportionately adjusted to the extent (if any) necessary to preserve the intended incentives\nof the awards and mitigate the impact of the transaction.\n• “TSR” shall be determined with respect to the Company and any other Comparison Group member by dividing: (a) the sum of\n(i) the difference obtained by subtracting the applicable Beginning Price from the applicable Ending Price and (ii) all dividends\nand other distributions during the Performance Period by (b) the applicable Beginning Price. Any non-cash distributions shall be\nvalued at fair market value. For the purpose of determining TSR, the value of dividends and other distributions shall be\ndetermined by treating them as reinvested in additional shares of stock at the closing market price on the date of distribution.\n• “Beginning Price” means, with respect to the Company and any other Comparison Group member, the average of the closing\nmarket prices of such company’s common stock on the principal exchange on which such stock is traded for the twenty (20)\nconsecutive trading days beginning with the first trading day of the Performance Period. For the purpose of determining\nBeginning Price, the value of dividends and other distributions shall be determined by treating them as reinvested in additional\nshares of stock at the closing market price on the date of distribution.\n• “Ending Price” means, with respect to the Company and any other Comparison Group member, the average of the closing\nmarket prices of such company’s common stock on the principal exchange on which such stock is traded for the twenty (20)\nconsecutive trading days ending on the last trading day of the Performance Period. For the purpose of determining Ending\nPrice, the value of dividends and other distributions shall be determined by treating them as reinvested in additional shares of\nstock at the closing market price on the date of distribution.\n    With respect to the computation of TSR, Beginning Price, and Ending Price, there shall also be an equitable and proportionate adjustment to\nthe extent (if any) necessary to preserve the intended incentives of the awards and mitigate the impact of any stock split, stock dividend or\nreverse stock split occurring during the Performance Period (or during the applicable twenty (20)-day period in determining Beginning Price or\nEnding Price, as the case may be).\n    In the event of any ambiguity or discrepancy, the determination of the Committee shall be final and binding.\n* * * * *'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 107}, page_content='Exhibit 19.1\nInsider Trading Policy\nA-2'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 108}, page_content='This policy is designed to prevent trading of securities when a person is aware of material nonpublic information.\nTrading while aware of material nonpublic information is a crime. Penalties for insider trading can include significant fines, monetary damages\nand prison time. In the United States, the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) and the Department of Justice prioritize these\ntypes of cases. They dedicate significant resources and use sophisticated electronic surveillance techniques to identify illegal trading\nactivities. The reason for the transaction, size of the transaction, or the amount of profit received does not have to be significant — even\nsmall insider trading violations may be monitored, aggressively investigated, and prosecuted. Agencies outside of the United States take a\nsimilar approach under local insider trading laws.\nWho is Covered by this Policy?\nThis policy applies to all Apple personnel, including directors, officers, employees, independent contractors, and consultants. It also applies to\nfamily members who reside with you or are financially dependent on you, and any other person or entity whose transactions in securities are\ndirected by you or are subject to your influence or control. This includes entities such as family trusts, partnerships and foundations. You must\nensure that people and entities whose trading activities you directly or indirectly influence or control, or those whose trading activity would\nreasonably be perceived by others to be under your influence or control, comply with the terms of this policy.\nInsider Trading Prohibitions\nNo Trading While Aware of Material Nonpublic Information. Never buy or sell Apple securities when aware of information that has not\nbeen publicly announced and that could have a material effect on the value of the securities. Information should be considered nonpublic for\nat least 24 hours after it has been distributed to the general public.\nNo Tipping. Do not disclose (“tip”) material nonpublic information to other persons, including family members, or make any\nrecommendation about whether to buy or sell Apple securities while aware of material nonpublic information.\nNo Third-Party Trading or Tipping. Do not trade in the securities of another company when aware of material nonpublic information about\nthat company in connection with your work at Apple. This includes trading in the stock of Apple suppliers, manufacturers, vendors or\ncustomers, such as cellular network carriers or other business partners. You must also not tip material nonpublic information about another\ncompany.\nNo Trading During Restricted Trading Periods. If you are subject to a restricted trading period, you must not buy or sell Apple securities\nwhile trading restrictions are in effect.\nNo Short Sales, Hedging or Trading in Derivatives. Short sales, transactions that hedge or offset, or are designed to hedge or offset, any\ndecrease in the value of Apple securities, and transactions in derivatives of Apple securities, are prohibited at all times. This includes\ntransactions involving prepaid variable forward contracts, equity swaps, collars, options, warrants, puts, calls, or similar instruments related to\nApple securities. Additionally, members of Apple’s Board of Directors and executive officers are prohibited from pledging Apple stock as\ncollateral.\nUpdated September 2024 2'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 109}, page_content='In addition to the above prohibitions, this policy includes important additional information.\n“Material” Nonpublic Information\nDetermining whether information is “material” requires consideration of all relevant facts and circumstances. In general, information is\nmaterial if it would likely be considered important by an investor who is deciding whether to buy or sell a security, or if the information is likely\nto have a significant effect on the market price of the security. Both positive and negative information may be material. “Materiality” is different\nfor different companies. Information that is not material to Apple may be material to another company.\n“Nonpublic” Information\n“Nonpublic” information means information that has not been previously disclosed to the general public and is otherwise not available to the\ngeneral public. Information should be considered nonpublic for at least 24 hours after it has been distributed to the general public through a\npress release, filing with the SEC, or similar means. The circulation of rumors, even if accurate and reported in the media, is not considered\neffective public distribution.\nPolicy Violations\nApple personnel who violate this policy may be subject to disciplinary action, including termination of employment and repayment of\nequity awards. Additionally, individuals who engage in illegal insider trading or tipping can be liable for substantial criminal and civil\npenalties.\nIf you have any doubt whether information is public or material, or have questions about this policy, consult Apple’s team by emailing\n[***] or calling [***].\nUpdated September 2024 3'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 110}, page_content='Restricted Trading Periods and Trading Windows\nA restricted trading period is a specified period of time during which designated Apple personnel, and their covered family members and\nentities, may not buy or sell Apple securities. If you are subject to trading restrictions, you will be notified by Apple’s Corporate Legal team.\nA trading window (sometimes referred to as an “open trading window”) is a specified period of time during which Apple personnel may buy or\nsell Apple securities, so long as the individual is not aware of material nonpublic information. Complying with restricted trading periods and\ntrading windows may protect you and Apple from regulatory investigations or insider trading allegations. However, even if you are not subject\nto restricted trading periods or no such period is in effect, you must not trade in Apple securities if you are aware of material nonpublic\ninformation about Apple.\nThe regularly scheduled restricted trading period and trading window for each quarter is indicated below.\nFiscal QuarterTrading Window Closed andTrading Restrictions Begin\nTrading Restrictions End and Trading Window Opens\n1 December 1 24 hours after public disclosure of first-quarter results (typically early February)\n2 March 1 24 hours after public disclosure of second-quarter results (typically early May)\n3 June 1 24 hours after public disclosure of third-quarter results (typically early August)\n4 September 1 24 hours after public disclosure of year-end results (typically early November)\nIn addition to these regularly scheduled restricted trading periods, Apple may impose a special restricted trading period or extend a restricted\ntrading period if necessary. If you become subject to a special or extended restricted trading period, you will be notified by Apple’s Corporate\nLegal team. If you are notified about a special or extended restricted trading period, you should not discuss it with others.\nPermitted Transactions\nThe transactions listed below are not subject to this policy’s restrictions, including during restricted trading periods and open trading\nwindows:\n• Vesting of restricted stock unit awards and the withholding of shares by Apple to satisfy tax-withholding requirements upon\nvesting;\n• Purchases under Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan;\n• Cash-settled stock option exercises under Apple’s equity plans (i.e., cash-settled “exercise and hold” transactions);\n• Transactions pursuant to a previously established contract, plan or instruction to trade in Apple’s securities (a “Trading\nPlan”) entered in accordance with Rule 10b5-1 (“Rule 10b5-1”) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended\n(the “Act”), and acknowledged by Apple’s Corporate Legal team; and\n• Bona fide gifts for estate planning purposes, including gifts to a trust, family limited partnership, charitable foundation or\nsimilar entity, as long as you or members of your immediate family remain the sole beneficiaries of the transferred shares\nand the terms of the transfer ensure that the shares remain subject to the same\nst\nnd\nrd\nth\nUpdated September 2024 4'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 111}, page_content='restrictions that apply to you under this policy; provided, however, that in all other instances gifts of securities are subject to\nthis policy, including the prohibition on trading during a restricted trading period and the requirement for Designated\nIndividuals to seek pre-clearance.\nAdditional Information Regarding Section 16 and Designated Individuals\nApple’s General Counsel and one or more authorized delegates serve as Apple’s Insider Trading Compliance Officer.\nMembers of the Board of Directors, executive officers and certain other individuals designated by Apple’s Insider Trading Compliance Officer,\nand family members who reside with them or are financially dependent on them, and any other person or entity who such individuals direct,\ninfluence, or control (or may be reasonably perceived to direct, influence, or control), are subject to additional restrictions. These individuals\nand their covered family members and entities are referred to as “Designated Individuals.” You will be notified by Apple’s Corporate Legal team\nif these restrictions apply to you.\nExcept for those permitted transactions listed above, all Designated Individuals must pre-clear all transactions in Apple securities with\nApple’s Insider Trading Compliance Officer. A request for pre-clearance must be submitted at least two business days prior to the date of a\nproposed transaction. If cleared, the Insider Trading Compliance Officer will issue a pre-clearance notice. Pre-clearance is valid only for the\nperiod specified in the notice.\nEach Designated Individual is responsible for ensuring they do not have material nonpublic information about Apple before engaging in a\ntransaction. Therefore, when a request for preclearance is made, they should carefully consider whether they are aware of any material\nnonpublic information about Apple and should describe those circumstances fully to the Insider Trading Compliance Officer. An Insider Trading\nCompliance Officer may not trade in Apple securities unless another Insider Trading Compliance Officer has pre-cleared the trade.\nMembers of the Board of Directors, executive officers and any other individuals subject to Section 16 (the “Section 16 reporting persons”) of the\nAct must also comply with the reporting obligations and limitations on short-swing profit transactions set forth in that section of the Act.\nRule 10b5-1 Trading Plans\nThe trading restrictions set forth in this policy do not apply to transactions under a Trading Plan that:\n• has been submitted to and pre-approved by Apple’s Corporate Legal team;\n• includes a “Cooling Off Period” for;\no Section 16 reporting persons (in which case the Cooling Off Period extends to the later of 90 days after adoption\nor modification of a Trading Plan or two business days after filing the Form 10-K or Form 10-Q covering the fiscal\nquarter in which the Trading Plan was adopted, up to a maximum of 120 days); and\no all other employees and other covered persons or entities, other than the company (in which case the Cooling Off\nPeriod extends to the later of 30 calendar days after the date the plan is executed and 24 hours after the public\nannouncement of our earnings for the quarter in which the plan is executed).\nUpdated September 2024 5'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 112}, page_content='• is established in good faith and not as part of a plan or scheme to evade the prohibitions of Rule 10b5-1 or Apple’s Insider\nTrading Policy;\n• is established at a time when you are unaware of material nonpublic information;\n• specifies the amount, price, and date of transactions (or includes a written formula, algorithm, or computer program for\ndetermining the amount, price, and date of transactions);\n• does not permit you to exercise any subsequent influence over how, when, or whether to make purchases or sales;\n• purchases or sales occur according to the Trading Plan without any deviation or alteration, and you do not enter into or alter a\ncorresponding or hedging transaction or position with respect to the securities covered by the Trading Plan; and\n• includes a representation in the Trading Plan that the Section 16 reporting person is (1) not aware of any material nonpublic\ninformation about Apple or its securities; and (2) adopting the Trading Plan in good faith and not as part of a plan or scheme to\nevade Rule 10b-5.\nApple’s Insider Trading Compliance Officer may impose such other conditions on the implementation and operation of the Trading Plan as\nApple’s Insider Trading Compliance Officer deems necessary or advisable. Individuals may not adopt more than one Trading Plan at a time\nexcept under the limited circumstances permitted by Rule 10b5-1 and subject to preapproval by Apple’s Insider Trading Compliance Officer.\nAn individual may only modify a Trading Plan during an open trading window at a time when they are not aware of material nonpublic\ninformation. Modifications to and terminations of a Trading Plan are subject to preapproval by Apple’s Corporate Legal team and modifications\nof a Trading Plan that change the amount, price, or timing of the purchase or sale of the securities underlying a Trading Plan will trigger a new\nCooling-Off Period.\nCompliance of a Trading Plan with the terms of Rule 10b5-1 and the execution of transactions pursuant to the Trading Plan are the sole\nresponsibility of the person initiating the Trading Plan.\nQuestions\nInsider trading laws often depend on specific facts and circumstances. This document provides only general guidance. Please contact [***] or\ncall [***] if you have any questions regarding this policy, Trading Plans, or your specific situation. If you are aware of a possible violation of this\npolicy, you should contact your manager and Apple’s Corporate Legal team.\nUpdated September 2024 6'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 113}, page_content='Exhibit 21.1\nSubsidiaries of\nApple Inc.*\nJurisdictionof Incorporation\nApple Asia Limited Hong Kong\nApple Asia LLC Delaware, U.S.\nApple Canada Inc. (the “Committee”), and covers Incentive-Based Compensation granted, awarded or paid\nby Apple Inc. or any of its subsidiaries (“Apple”) to any employee who is an “executive officer” of Apple (each a “Covered\nExecutive”) as defined under Section 10D-1 of the Securities and Exchange Act  of 1934 (“Exchange Act”). The Policy is\nintended to comply with, and as applicable to be administered and interpreted consistent with, and subject to the\nexceptions set forth in, Listing Rule 5608 adopted by the Nasdaq Stock Market to implement Rule 10D-1 under the\nExchange Act (collectively referred to herein as “Rule 10D-1”). For avoidance of doubt the Policy only applies to Covered\nExecutives who served as a Covered Executive for Apple at any point during the performance period for any Incentive-\nBased Compensation that is Received on or after October 2, 2023. The Policy explains when Apple will be required to\nseek recovery of erroneously awarded Incentive-Based Compensation from a Covered Executive.\nB.Incentive-Based Compensation\nFor purposes of this Policy, “Incentive-Based Compensation” means any compensation granted, earned or vested based\nin whole or in part upon the attainment of one or more financial reporting measures, that was Received (i) on or after\nOctober 2, 2023 and (ii) by a person who served as a Covered Executive at any time during the performance period for\nthe Incentive-Based Compensation. Financial reporting measures are (i) any measure(s) that are determined and\npresented in accordance with the accounting principles used in Apple’s financial statements and any measure(s) derived\nin whole or in part from such measure(s) and (ii) any measure(s) that are based in whole or in part on Apple’s stock price\nor total shareholder return. For avoidance of doubt, Incentive-Based Compensation includes awards granted to a\nCovered Executive that are outstanding and unvested as of October 2, 2023. Incentive-Based Compensation is\n“Received” in the fiscal period that the relevant financial reporting measure is attained regardless of when it is paid or\nawarded.\nFor avoidance of doubt, incentive-based compensation that is not earned or vested based on the attainment of one or\nmore financial measures, including but not limited to time-based restricted stock units, is not covered compensation\nunder this Policy but may be recouped under the Apple Inc. Executive Team Compensation Recoupment Policy.'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 119}, page_content='C.Administration\nThe Committee is authorized and directed to consult with the full Board or such other committees of the Board as may\nbe necessary or appropriate for the administration of this Policy and engage third parties as it deems necessary to\nevaluate erroneously awarded Incentive-Based Compensation Received. If the Committee determines Incentive-Based\nCompensation was erroneously awarded and recovery is required pursuant to this Policy, Apple shall make any required\ndisclosures for any affected Covered Executives in its annual proxy statement. Apple will maintain and will provide to the\nNasdaq Stock Market documentation of all determinations and actions taken in complying with the Policy. Any\ndeterminations made by the Committee under this Policy shall be final and binding on all affected individuals.\nD.Section 10D-1 Recovery\nPursuant to Rule 10D-1, the Committee will make reasonable efforts to recover any Incentive-Based Compensation\nReceived by any Covered Executive during the three completed fiscal years immediately preceding the date that Apple\nis required to prepare an Accounting Restatement under Rule 10D-1 and any transition period of less than nine months\nthat is within or immediately following such three years if the Committee determines the Incentive-Based Compensation\nwas erroneously awarded. An “Accounting Restatement” is a correction to Apple’s financial statements that, due to\nApple’s material noncompliance with any financial reporting requirement under U.S. federal securities laws, is (1) is\nmaterial to a prior financial reporting period or (2) would be material to the current financial reporting period if corrected\nin the current period or left uncorrected in the current period.\nRecovery will be limited to the amount of the gross, pre-tax, Incentive-Based Compensation that was erroneously\nReceived because it exceeded the amount that would have been Received had it been determined based on any\nrestated financial measures in the Accounting Restatement. If the Incentive-Based Compensation is based on stock\nprice or total shareholder return, the Committee shall determine a reasonable estimate of the effect of the Accounting\nRestatement, if any, on the stock price or total shareholder return and based on that reasonable estimate, whether\nIncentive-Based Compensation was erroneously awarded.\nIf the erroneously awarded Incentive-Based Compensation cannot be recovered because recovery efforts are\nexcessively burdensome, the recovery value exceeds the cost of recovery to Apple or recovery would be contrary to\nlaws outside the United States, each as determined in accordance with Rule 10D-1, the Committee will make a\ndetermination whether further recovery efforts would be in shareholders’ best interests and should continue or would\notherwise be excusable under Rule 10D-1.\n2'), Document(metadata={'source': './aapl.pdf', 'page': 120}, page_content='If the Committee determines a Covered Executive Received erroneously awarded Incentive-Based Compensation, the\nCommittee shall determine the timing and method of recovery in its sole direction and direct Apple to recover any\nerroneously awarded amounts as soon as administratively practicable. The methods of recovery include but are not\nlimited to, requiring reimbursement from the Covered Executive, electing to withhold or suspend unpaid Incentive-Based\nCompensation, by offset (subject to the requirements of Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as\namended (the “Code”) if applicable), forcing the sale of shares issued pursuant to Incentive-Based Compensation,\nrescinding, cancelling, or otherwise causing the forfeiture of any unvested or unpaid Incentive-Based Compensation,\ndeducting from amounts otherwise payable to the Covered Executive including base salary, commissions, time-based\nequity awards or other compensation, or by requiring incremental payments from the Covered Executive using one or\nmore of the above methods or any other methods authorized by applicable law.\nApple shall not indemnify any Covered Executive for the loss of any Incentive-Based Compensation or the cost of any\nthird-party insurance to cover the same.\nE.Rights and Remedies; Waiver; Amendment; Extension\nThis Policy shall supplement and not limit any other rights or remedies Apple may have under applicable law, any other\nApple policy, including the Apple Inc. Executive Team Compensation Recoupment Policy, any applicable plan,\nagreement, other arrangement, or otherwise, including, but not limited to, termination of employment, initiation of other\ndisciplinary procedures, and/or the institution of civil or criminal proceedings, provided however, if Incentive-Based\nCompensation is recovered under this Policy it would not be subject to double recovery under any other Apple policy,\nplan, agreement or arrangement unless specifically required under applicable law.\nThis Policy may from time to time be waived, amended, or extended to other employees of Apple, as determined by the\nCommittee, or as otherwise required under Rule 10D-1.\n***\n3')]

Form 10-K Summary  83\nSignatures   84\n2'), Document(metadata={'source': './nvidia.pdf', 'page': 2}, page_content="Table of Contents\nWhere You Can Find More Information\nInvestors and others should note that we announce material financial information to our investors using our investor relations website, press releases, SEC\nfilings and public conference calls and webcasts. We also use the following social media channels as a means of disclosing information about the company, ourproducts, our planned financial and other announcements and attendance at upcoming investor and industry conferences, and other matters and for complyingwith our disclosure obligations under Regulation FD:\nNVIDIA X Account (https://twitter.com/nvidia)\nNVIDIA Corporate Blog (http://blogs.nvidia.com)\nNVIDIA Facebook Page (https://www.facebook.com/nvidia)\nNVIDIA LinkedIn Page (http://www.linkedin.com/company/nvidia)\nNVIDIA Instagram Page (https://www.instagram.com/nvidia)\nIn addition, investors and others can view NVIDIA videos on YouTube (https://www.YouTube.com/nvidia).\nThe information we post through these social media channels may be deemed material. These channels may be updated from time to time on NVIDIA's investor relationswebsite.\nForward-Looking Statements\nThis Annual Report on Form 10-K contains forward-looking statements which are based on our management's beliefs and assumptions and on informationcurrently available to our management. In some cases, you can identify forward-looking statements by terms such as “may,” “will,” “should,” “could,” “goal,”\n“would,” “expect,” “plan,” “anticipate,” “believe,” “estimate,” “project,” “predict,” “potential,” and similar expressions intended to identify forward-lookingstatements.
